main.name: Chris Dunn
main.description: who focuses on Voice Skills for Alexa development
main.bio: I am an entrepreneurially minded developer who believes that technology is about more than bits and bytes. I started my career selling real estate a far cry from developing software, but I've always tried to keep my eye on the future. I firmly believe the future is voice activated devices and I love that I get to help build that everyday. I love exploring what this technology can allow us to do and what it's future might look like. When I'm not doing that, I love endurance sports.
main.contactmessage: Have a project for me? Think I'd be a good fit for your team? I'd love to hear from you, give me a shout by email or by using the form below if you'd like to get in contact with me.

resume.skillmessage: These are just a few of the technologies that I've worked with

education.description: As an undergard I started my first company 'Boulder Junkies' a junk removal service. I was history major but I took a few business school classes as well.

work.title: Full Stack Developer
work.description: I completed immersive Full Stack Developer bootcamp, which required 50-60 hrs per week of language learning and skill building on both Frontend and Backend software development.  We extensively practiced pair programming, Object Oriented Programming (OOP) and Test Driven Development (TDD). I also actively used TDD on a weekly basis to evaluate and improve programming knowledge.

work.title: Broker Owner
work.description: I founded a boutique Real Estate brokerage, then hired and trained new agents to become reliable, informative, and successful $100k producers. I also implemented new technologies, such as Wordpress and Hubspot, in order to run the business with an eye on the intersection of real estate and tech.

work.title: Agent/CTO
work.description: Here I implemented G Suite for 40 plus agents. I also did some networking hardware installations.

skills.name: Git
skills.description: I use Git for all of my projects so far. I have used Git for version control in small teams and have toyed around with contributing to Open Source Projects.

skills.name: React Js
skills.description: React was the javascript framework I learned in my bootcamp program and I’ve gone on to use in most of my projects. I’ve really loved using it for JAMstack projects. I love the build it once and use it again and again aspect.

skills.name: Ruby
skills.description: Ruby was the first language I learned and Rails obviously provides one of the quickest ways to quickly scale up a new site. I’ve done a few projects that used Ruby for the backend.

skills.name: PostgreSQL
skills.description: For the projects that I’ve worked on thus far, relational databases have been the best use case. I look forward to the opportunity to work on projects that use NoSQL structure in the future so I can expand my horizons.

skills.name: Node JS
skills.description: Node JS has been something I’ve come into while building my Alexa skills as this is my primary scripting language for my lambda functions.

skills.name: SSML
skills.description: When you work with Voice Skills, SSML allows you to create incredible user experiences. I believe this langauge will grow tremendously in popularity over the next few years.

skills.name: Bootstrap 4
skills.description: I've used bootstrap on a few projects as it's more widely used than foundation which I used on my first couple of projects.

skills.name: Heroku
skills.description: I've used Heroku as my hosting platform for my fullstack applications. The ability to quickly deploy from Github makes it a wonderful platform to work with.

projects.title: Buff Trivia
projects.category: Trivia Skill for Alexa based on the University of Colorado

projects.title: 2020 Meme-Maker
projects.category: React app that allows users to create meme's of 2020 presidential candidates

projects.title: Farina Roofing
projects.category: Portfolio Website I built for a roofing company.

projects.title: iTunes Music Charts
projects.category: A react based itunes styled itunes chart. Uses iTunes API to display downloads
